text.__SUMMARY__: Quercus oblongata is the accepted name of a tree species in the Asian sub-genus of 'ring-cupped oaks' and the family Fagaceae; there are no known subspecies.This oak tree grows up to 20 m tall and has been recorded from Vietnam, where it may be called sồi bạch mao.
